column1: Nizhny Lomov (Russian: Ни́жний Ломо́в) is a town and the administrative center of Nizhnelomovsky District in Penza Oblast
column3: located on the Lomov River (Oka's basin)
column4: on the M5 Highway 109 kilometers (68 mi) northwest of Penza
column5: the administrative center of the oblast. Population: 22

column1: It was founded as an outpost in 1636 as part of the Belgorod Line defense system. It was later known as Lomovskaya sloboda
column3: and the village of Nizhny Lomov. Town status was granted to it in 1780.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Nizhny Lomov serves as the administrative center of Nizhnelomovsky District. As an administrative division
column3: it is incorporated within Nizhnelomovsky District as the town of district significance of Nizhny Lomov. As a municipal division
column4: the town of district significance of Nizhny Lomov is incorporated within Nizhnelomovsky Municipal District as Nizhny Lomov Urban Settlement.
